2313140.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313140
In-book reference  : Book 57, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 57, Hadith 001
2313140.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The person who is strong is not strong because he can knock people down. The person who is strong is the one who controls himself when he is angry."

2313150.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313150
In-book reference  : Book 57, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 57, Hadith 002
2313150.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "There is nothing that is swallowed greater with Allah in reward than a slave of Allah who swallows and contains his rancour out of desire for the pleasure of Allah."

2313160.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313160
In-book reference  : Book 57, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 57, Hadith 003
2313160.text: "I seek refuge with Allah from the Accursed Shaytan."' The man went to that man and said, 'Do you know what he said? He said, "I seek refuge with Allah from the Accursed Shaytan."' The man retorted. 'Do you think me mad?'"

2313165.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313165
In-book reference  : Book 57, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 57, Hadith 004
2313165.text: A variant of the previous hadith.

2313170.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313170
In-book reference  : Book 57, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 57, Hadith 005
2313170.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, ' Teach and make it easy. Teach and make it easy.' three times. He went on, 'When you are angry, be silent' twice."

2313180.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313180
In-book reference  : Book 57, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 57, Hadith 006
2313180.text: 'Ali was heard to say to Ibn al-Kawwa', "Do you know what the first one said? 'Loving the one you love is an easy matter. It may be that one day he will be the one you hate. Hating the one who hate is an easy matter, It may be that one day he will be the one you hate.'"

2313190.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313190
In-book reference  : Book 57, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 57, Hadith 007
2313190.text: Aslam said, " 'Umar ibn al-Khattab said, 'Do not let your love be a total infatuation. Do not let your anger be destruction.' I asked, 'How is that?' He replied, 'When you love, you are infatuated like a child. When you hate, you desire destruction for your companion.'"
